intro: Grewiopsis trillesiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Grewiopsis trillesiana is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
